intro: Rosa rubiginosa f. echinocarpa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a botanical variant of the shrub rose. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and dark red, almost black, flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are typically edible but not particularly flavorful. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. This form is noted for its hardiness and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
